title: Chandrayaan-2: Fake Twitter Handles of ISRO Chief K Sivan Mushroom
subtitle: Chandrayaan-2 ISRO Chairman Fact-Check: On early hours of Saturday, 7 September, Chandrayaan-2 mission faced a setback when ISRO lost communication with ‘Vikram’ lander when it was at an altitude of 2.1 kms from the lunar surface.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
In the early hours of Saturday, 7 September, Chandrayaan-2 mission faced a setback when Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) lost communication with its Vikram lander at an altitude of 2.1 km from the lunar surface.

The entire country stood by ISRO and its chairman K Sivan. Amidst all this, a fake Twitter account was made in his name, and it garnered over 30,000 followers.
